name: Loews Le Concorde Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is located approximately 10 walking minutes from the historic center of Quebec City. The rooms are nice and clean as you would expect it from that kind of accomodation. There are no special highlights to point out, but unfortunately there are some issues I didn't like very much like e.g. no free internet access in the rooms. You can buy online time via WLAN (really slow, frequent disconnects, ...), the hotel's TV system seems not to be maintained too well - you get boot-screens of PCs or shells of linux systems on some TV channels. Worst of all is the elevator system. You have to calculate additional 5 to 10 minutes if you want to get from e.g. 22nd floor to the lobby. It appears that only a fraction of the 4 elevators are working... that's a real pain!
reviews.title: Average Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights at the Loews Le Concorde in early August. This was our third time at this property in recent years...and will likely make it our Quebec City hotel.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like the hotel first for its price—under $200/night with a bit of shopping around. The Noel is also conveniently located minutes away from the old part of Quebec.
reviews.title: Hotel for Pets

reviews.text: The concierge service is on par with most large hotels. Their recommendations for restaurants and tours always prove to be fruitful.
reviews.title: Very Nice for the restaurant.

reviews.text: On a few warm days, free bottles of water in the front lobby were a welcome sight.
reviews.title: Just OK with some minor problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others mentioned, the elevator service is horrible especially when tour groups arrive.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: The rooms are in need of updating and free WiFi in the rooms is a modern day necessity. The price charged for it was very high and although it is free in the Lobby, the check in desk failed to inform us of the login and password.
reviews.title: Great location, great value, great service
Bed bugs and more
reviews.text: But location, location, location. Great food and wine within steps and walking distance to the old port.

My two teenages daughters and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. It was perfect. Great value for what you get: so close to the Vieux-Québec, has a great pool, an awesome view and the personnel of the hotel were all professional, polite, pleasant and very serviable. Also, it is located right beside the Plaines d'Abraham park. Wow. The concierge proposed lots of fun activities for us, and took the time to explain and guide us.
reviews.title: Great Location in a great city

reviews.text: Although the service was terrific at pool and desk...bed bugs pretty much sum it up. They seemed to know they had a problem.I stayed here a number of years ago and it has gone downhill...outdated and slowest elevators ever.
reviews.title: Elevators are a true hassle

reviews.text: We stayed at Le Concorde for 2 nights, June 17/18 2007. Two adults and two children ages 17 and 20. The hotel was superb, the room was enormous and the staff could not have been more hospitable. Our room was $179.00 not including taxes, and parking ($23.00 daily - valet).
reviews.title: Le Concorde...Tres Bien!
wiaste of money
reviews.text: Before arriving, become a member of the Loews First club. I got this idea from Tripadvisor reviewer. Tt was a great idea...and it's FREE!
This membership entitles you to a newspaper, snack (or other treat) upon arrival, and upgraded room when available, not to mention some other perks.
reviews.title: Just above average
Like the Hotel, but not the other guest
reviews.text: Have the buffet lunch at L'Astral, a revolving rooftop restaurant. It's only $21.00 per person and the view alone is worth it, and the food isn't too bad either! Dinner is much more expensive ($42.00 for the buffet).

Have dinner at Le Couchon Dingue (The Pink Pig) in the lower city. Dinner for four including dessert (no liquor) all the taxes (two)and gratuity was about $90.00. The indoor dining room is non smoking!
reviews.title: Reliable and good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a romantic getaway at the Loews Concorde and everything was as expected. The staff was nice and courteous and we received good service from the check-in to the pool and room service. The revolving restaurant had a great view of Quebec city, the buffet was good, but I wouldn't go back since there is so much more to discover in that area.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good service

likes.liked: — Being so near to Old Quebec

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a premium room through the hotel website and were given a room on the 25th floor--the highest guest room is on the 26th floor--with a killer view of Old Quebec and St. Lawrence Seaway. (The hotel is a slab with half the rooms facing Old Quebec and the seaway, and half facing away.)
reviews.title: Great views and luxurious room

likes.liked: — location, food, revolving restaurant including its food

reviews.text: This may be a matter of personal preference, but I thought the location ideal. The hotel is a couple of blocks above the old city which I found too tourist trappy. It is located on a block of great restaurants. It is also located in a nice leafy area of Quebec with some interesting restaurants located a few blocks in the opposite direction of the Old Quebec. In short, it is ideally located for walking, either to the old city, or in the opposite direction in a lovely neighborhood.
reviews.title: Loved the Loews

reviews.text: We ate lunch twice in the revolving restaurant on the top. The lunch menu was excellent and competitive in price with comparable ground level restaurants.
reviews.title: look good on ouside but not inside

reviews.text: Although the room was quite luxurious this is a hotel that seeks out tour busses and other groups. Our first 2 nights of a 4 night stay the hotel hosted a high school prom. Our price in US dollars including parking ($21/day) and taxes but not including internet or food was $1325 for the 4 nights. I'm sure the prom groups and other groups were paying a lot less. We certainly did enjoy the quiet and the view of our 25th floor room. However, it is hard to evaluate the "value" part of the review when you figure your are paying a lot more than the average guest.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but terrible internet connection/business services

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a beautiful view of the Plains of Abraham. I was worried about the bedbugs and the elevator service, the room was spotless and we checked it thoroughly. The elevators were a minor problem and were quite busy only between 5-6:00 p.m. The concierge was top notch, she really knows her stuff. She recommended Bistro Moss for Moules and frites and a bakery Paillard that had the best pastries I have ever tasted.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: Sadly, Loews has allowed a first rate location turn into a neo-dump. If the rate is that low, there must be a reason, alas I did not heed this warning before staying at this has been habitat. Having booked a suite for a four night stay, I expected a room befitting the Loews moniker. Unfortunately, my suite had not been renovated in the last twenty some odd years. No kidding. Worn furniture, stained carpets, linens that I wouldn't sleep on in a homeless shelter. The wallpaper was curling off and the paint and counters were peeling and cracked throughout. This is definitely NOT a four star property. Even by inflated Internet rating standards this property would be fortunate enough to garner two stars. So, if you are considering the Loews Le Concorde, ask yourself why the rates are so low and then move on to a hotel that does not have an overdue date with the wrecking ball.
reviews.title: Not so Suite

reviews.text: This hotel has some great attributes. The hotel staff was helpful and had no issues communicating in English which I appreciated. My room was large and spotless, couldn’t ask for more. I liked the location; it is steps from numerous dining options, a short walk to the old city and adjacent to the Plains of Abraham.
reviews.title: not bad, not awesome

reviews.text: The challenges offset my otherwise good experience. As others have mentioned the elevators are a disaster. I agree with others suggestions of adding 5-10 minutes to your travel time just for elevators. Ridiculous! The pool and pool deck area is small. I had planned to spend some down time out there but there was no place to sit and the pool was busy. I didn’t eat at the hotel, but had one drink in the bar off the lobby. I only had one drink because the service was very slow and not at all pleasant. The wi-fi often did not work in the room, but did work in the lobby. The lobby code was only offered up after I complained about the poor connection in my room.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT SERVICE AND VALUE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn’t consider staying here again until the elevator and wi-fi issues were fixed, despite all the very nice aspects of the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful, clean, wonderful Staff

reviews.text: We stayed at the Loews Concorde for a business conference. At times only 1 of 4 elevators worked. We waited over 20 minutes for an elevator and opted to walk the 8 flights a couple of times. The pool and exercise area was very dated and only 3 chaise lounges. The carpet in our room had many stains. Air conditioning units were very noisey and hard to control the temperature. Decor in the room was also in need of an update. Wireless internet did not work. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel! On a positive note, the view from the roof top restaurant was amazing and breakfasts were good.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Wonderful, comfortable. Great location next to a wonderful park.
reviews.title: More than what we expected, amazing staff and accomodations. Best of all our dachshund was treated like a prince.

reviews.text: The location was perfect for exploring Quebec. This was my first visit and it is on the main street that goes down into the old city. The rooms were comfy and clean. The staff friendly and helpful especially with none of us speaking French. Although they had high speed internet this was an $11.00 a day extra charge. Most places I stay are free now. The major downfall was the elevators. We waited over a 30 minutes for an elevator trying to get to the lobby. Anyone using the elevator(s) had the same complaint. They have signs apologizing for the inconvenience but had I known I would have made reservations elsewhere. When this is resolved they will get 4 to 5 stars.
reviews.title: Call me when the elevators are fixed.

reviews.text: Stayed for four nights. Located next to the main tourist restaurant drag, and right on the Plains of Abraham, so perfect location. 10 minute walk to the promenade, easy access to walking and jogging, lots of restaurants in the area, good views (from the 19th floor). Ate in the revolving restaurant for lunch, which was a buffet each day, and very nice food, although revolving isn't for everyone - one of the group called it the 'Spinerama'. Room quite large, good amenities, serviced well. Didn't access mini-bar. Meeting rooms clean, serviced well, staff attentitve. As referenced by other travellers, the elevators are a bit of a nightmare - toook a very long time to come, skipped floors, stopped at other floors for no reason, not level witht he floor when the doors opened. Being serviced the entire four days, with no improvement. And my current bugbear - no free internet, which when every Motel 6 offers it is unconscionable in a hotel of this calibre.
reviews.title: Nice Room, Great Location, Elevators an Adventure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife on a weekend trip to Quebec in the fall. Location is pretty good, only a 10-15 minute walk to the old city. Many restaurants and bars in the area. Hotel was clean, rooms were nice and modern. Top-floor revolving restaurant/bar was a nice spot for a drink, but pricey. Great impression by the staff, as we made a huge blunder and forgot our valuables in the room safe. The front desk notified us within hours of check-out, and returned to retrieve before our bus to Montreal. Would stay here again when visiting Quebec.
reviews.title: Very nice staff and clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel frequently for work and this is definitely NOT a 4-star hotel.
reviews.title: Do NOT stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you book on the internet (priceline, expedia, etc) you will be given a room on a lower floor (ie. not renovated)- I had to fight with the manager to be moved as I wouldn't even sit down in the the first room they gave us (old cracked furniture, felt very dirty). The renovated rooms aren't much better and barely resemble the misleading photos on their website.
reviews.title: Now What You May Expect

likes.disliked: — Outdated decor, lack of soul, ordinary service

reviews.text: We love Loews hotels but this is not comparable to their other properties and I would NOT stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation Choice

likes.disliked: — Elevator service. Only 4 elevators for 29 floors.

reviews.title: Excellent choice
reviews.text: This hotel used to be a great star in Quebec City during the 70s and 80s, but lost a great share of its shine in the last 10-15 years. Anybody having stayed at Montreal's Loews Vogue Hotel, which is a true five-star awarded hotel, will without a doubt agree that Quebec's Le Concorde does not quite fit in Loews's current portfolio. It is, HOWEVER, still a great place to stay, especially for its exceptional location and upsale accomodations. But if, relying on Loews name, your expectations are set at a very high level, there is some disappointment ahead. Here are a few quick facts expressing pros and cons:
- Location is EXCELLENT.
reviews.title: Where to start?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the 2nd leg of our honeymoon adventure at Loews le Concorde Hotel – it was time to unwind and relax after Mexico! Prior to our arrival, I was a tad concerned after reading some negatives reviews on Tripadvisor. I do travel for business and get to stay at upscale hotels so I have some comparison for our stay at Loews. We were pleasantly surprised and can’t wait to go back! The room was clean, modern, and had a great view of the Old Quebec. It is an older hotel but they’ve done a good job keeping it up. Not the Ritz...but it’s good value for the location. The staff was very friendly and helpful....from the doorman to the front desk to the housekeeping! (Minus the rude bartender in the bar area) Even with my poor French, we enjoyed our honeymoon stay in Old Quebec. Loews was walking distance to old city gate....great value for a modern hotel stay. Tips: Skip The Canon’s Restaurant on the Grande Alle.....the WORST meal I’ve ever had...plus the view of the giant rat. Go to the Farmer’s Market. Amazing local products. Our favorite meal was at the Le Patriarche! It was a very romantic evening with the snow falling, Christmas music, and the most amazing meal..... we couldn’t have planned it better. We had such a great stay that we extend a couple days.... Can’t wait to go back and stay at Loews again when it’s not 15 degrees and snowing. :)
reviews.title: Relaxing and Romance in Quebec!

reviews.text: We have used this hotel for our employees overnight business meetings over the past three years as the rates are reasonable and the hotel is in our opinion a 3 Star North American standard.
reviews.title: Will Never Return

reviews.text: Please be cautious if you arrive in the evening.
reviews.title: Quality Service, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We sent our employee in November for a 2 night stay, upon arrival the indoor parking which they advertise availablity for all their guests was full. Upon checking in, the person at the front desk appologized and instructed our employee to park on the side of the hotel, as it was hotel property and the car would not be towed.
reviews.title: Great location, great room!

likes.disliked: — price especially with the canadian and quebec province taxes added

reviews.text: Much to his surprise the car had been towed overnight, which resulted in his being late for a convention and a hefty $117.00 traffic violation.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel!

likes.disliked: — The you could smell cigarette smoke occasionally.

description: Loews Hôtel Le Concorde vous offre le meilleur emplacement en ville, juste à l'entrée du Vieux-Québec. Chacune des 406 chambres spacieuses, dispose d’une vue panoramique sur la ville et le fleuve St-Laurent. À deux pas de l’hôtel, profitez de la vie nocturne de la Grande-Allée ou faites une promenade sur les maginifiques Plaines d'Abraham. Savourez la vue et de la gastronomie de renom à L'Astral, notre restaurant panoramique tournant.-Loews Le Concorde Hotel offers you the best location in town, right at the entrance of Old Quebec. 406 spacious guestrooms, all with panoramic views of the city and the St-Lawrence river. Enjoy the nightlife on Grande-Allée street or have a rejunevating walk on the Plains of Abraham, just steps away from the hotel. Savor the view and renowned gastronomy at L'Astral, the hotel's rooftop revolving restaurant.
